comments.body: I don't think we need to set the minimum version.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +41,45 @@mleap
# Required by mlflow.spark
pyspark
# Required by mlflow.shap
shap

comments.body:
In `shap`, `ipython` is included as a extra dependency:

https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/54e6f0f10aa0442734aade259fc9712c4bf16537/setup.py#L183-L187

```python
    extras_require = {
        'plots': [
            'matplotlib',
            'ipython'
        ],
```

`matplotlib` is wrapped by try-except to prevent an import error:

https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/54e6f0f10aa0442734aade259fc9712c4bf16537/shap/plots/_image.py#L8

```python
try:
    import matplotlib.pyplot as pl
except ImportError:
    warnings.warn("matplotlib could not be loaded!")
    pass
```
but `ipython` is not:

https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/master/shap/plots/_image.py#L15

```python
from IPython.core.display import display, HTML
```

```
pip install 'shap[plots]'
```

should work too but this installs `matplotlib`

Filed a PR in the shap repo: https://github.com/slundberg/shap/pull/1749

I'll insert a comment on when we can remove `ipython`.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +42,46 @@shap
# Remove `ipython` once this issue: https://github.com/slundberg/shap/pull/1749 has been addressed
ipython

comments.body:
Could we also consolidate these comments, since they're all kind of repetitive and identical in the form:
```
required by mlflow.x
x
```
i.e. something like "each of these libraries are required by their respective mlflow library APIs." or better wording to that effect?

# Required by mlflow.gluon

comments.body: If it's too hard to get tests to pass after unpinning libraries in this file, perhaps we can merge the unpinning of MLflow's core / non-ML-extra requirements and then follow up with a PR to unpin extra ML requirements.
